channel.title: Bucky's Tutorials
channel.description:
Some of you may know this guy from YouTube, and some may not. But this guy, named Bucky Roberts, is a very helpful guy. He has uploaded completed tutorials for several different programming languages and also provides scientific tutorials. He's funny and can explain better than many professors' boring lectures. All of the videos I've seen by him are very helpful and shorter than 10 minutes.
So I just wanted to share Bucky's YouTube channel with MoparScape because I believe he deserves more views due to his great tutorials.
Bucky's YouTube Channel (Contains the tutorials): http://www.youtube.com/user/thenewboston Bucky's Other YouTube Channel (Some Vlog and real-life videos): http://www.youtube.com/user/thenewbostonTV
Just click the name of the language you want to learn from him and it'll start the playlist.
►[url=http://tinyurl.com/8hgwj94]Java (Beginners)[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/9wz98yw]Java (Intermediate)[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/a3npes6]Java (Game Development)[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/bce9dxz]JavaScript[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/b6rwzpm]C++[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/b2ghdzx]C++ (2)[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/ban2uo9]C++ With GUI[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/ajtwhoa]C#[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/aduueue]C[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/bbwmvgz]Python[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/b9ztkk2]PyGame[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/ajw2rjx]PHP[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/bkk2cmm]Objective C[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/beytajp]iPhone Development[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/azhtesp]Android[/url] ►[url=http://tinyurl.com/bfqj6gg]Visual Basic[/url]

item.title: Bucky's Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:12, topic:468584”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=585556.msg4161237#msg4161237 date=1353121700]

May I know the exact number of Java tutorials you watched from him? Because from your the way you type, it seems like you’ve watched 2 minutes of a random tutorial.

He does that in nearly ALL his tutorials…
[/quote]He doesn’t need conventions, first of all.[/quote]
You can’t be serious.

He never finishes his tutorials, he overly explains the simple stuff, and doesn’t explain the harder points…

Read full topic

avoid his java tutorials like the plague

item.title: Bucky's Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @_s11 s1gma
item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:10, topic:468584”][quote author=s1gma link=topic=585556.msg4161079#msg4161079 date=1353110853]

[quote author=usman555 link=topic=585556.msg4161060#msg4161060 date=1353108956]

[quote author=s1gma link=topic=585556.msg4160860#msg4160860 date=1353095422]
avoid his java tutorials like the plague
[/quote]What’s wrong with them? He probably knows a lot more Java than you.
[/quote]fuk off

they’re very, very shit. he avoids conventions, irrelevantly names shit stupidly and generally doesn’t explain things well nor does he explain them correctly. they’re a fuking joke

edit: whoever put this filter that turns properly spelt fuks into love is an idiot and should die
[/quote]May I know the exact number of Java tutorials you watched from him? Because from your the way you type, it seems like you’ve watched 2 minutes of a random tutorial.[/quote]how about you educate yourself by looking through my past posts ok

[quote=“usman555, post:12, topic:468584”][quote author=imthenull link=topic=585556.msg4161237#msg4161237 date=1353121700]

May I know the exact number of Java tutorials you watched from him? Because from your the way you type, it seems like you’ve watched 2 minutes of a random tutorial.

He does that in nearly ALL his tutorials…
[/quote]He doesn’t need conventions, first of all. He verbally explains what he is going to do, what he is doing and what he did. He names things ‘stupidly’ because it randomly comes into his mind, and people find it funny. He DOES explain things. He sets a goal for the next tutorial and summarizes all the code at the end. That’s what he does in nearly ALL his tutorials.

I really like how you guys bash on a person who takes time out and helps people for free.[/quote]sun/oracle set conventions for a reason you dolt, this isn’t a case in like C/C++ where there’s stylistic preferences to writing code because java’s conventions are outlined and recommended by the creators of the damn language, although the constituent parts of conventions vary in their following i.e. brace placement can often vary from person to person whereas class/package naming conventions are somethings that basically need to be concrete. oh and just because his naming is funny doesn’t mean it’s good, and the fact that he names things randomly probably indicates that he doesn’t understand the vitalness of good naming

as for verbal explanation,cool, i guess it’s more subjective at how well he explains him although i wouldn’t rely upon someone who defends his shit to be at all an accurate voice in the argument.

i’m not saying his presentation is bad, it’s actually better than most people’s but presentation means love all when the content is wrong/inaccurate and that’s exactly what his java tuts suffer from. that’s why i consider them bad, they promote bad practice and the irritating thing is that the quality of the presentation leads people to believe and argue that what they’re being taught is good which is an exemplary non sequitur

Read full topic

item.title: Bucky's Tutorials
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:12, topic:468584”]He doesn’t need conventions, first of all. He verbally explains what he is going to do, what he is doing and what he did. He names things ‘stupidly’ because it randomly comes into his mind, and people find it funny. He DOES explain things. He sets a goal for the next tutorial and summarizes all the code at the end. That’s what he does in nearly ALL his tutorials.

I really like how you guys bash on a person who takes time out and helps people for free.[/quote]
Teaching a language sloppily is not an excuse. He does not explain his code. He doesn’t work for free, it’s called AdSense. I don’t mean to flame, just trying to push my opinion in.

Read full topic
